jparsec.io.device

Class VirtualCamera

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.io.device.VirtualCamera
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GenericCamera

    public class VirtualCamera
extends java.lang.Object
implements GenericCamera
    An implementation of the camera interface for virtual cameras.
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Field Detail

      • DRAW_DSO_TEXTURES

        public static boolean DRAW_DSO_TEXTURES
        Set to true (default value) to allow the rendering of deep sky objects as textures, or to false to show only stars.

      • DRAW_PLANETARY_TEXTURES

        public static boolean DRAW_PLANETARY_TEXTURES
        Set to true (default value) to allow the rendering of planetary textures.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VirtualCamera

        public VirtualCamera(GenericCamera.CAMERA_MODEL model,
             GenericTelescope telescope,
             int index)
              throws JPARSECException
        The constructor for a virtual camera.
        Parameters:
        model - The camera model.
        telescope - The telescope instance, required to know the shooting position and the field of view.
        index - The index of the camera (count number, starting with 0) in this telescope.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the camera is not virtual.

      • setCameraOrientation

        public boolean setCameraOrientation(double ang)
        Description copied from interface: GenericCamera
        Sets the camera orientation respect the mount of the telescope. In case the telescope is in a equatorial mount, 0 means the camera/image 'up' direction is north (or south if the telescope inverts the image). This is used for the reduction pipeline later, the value set here should be as approximate as possible.
        Specified by:
        setCameraOrientation in interface GenericCamera
        Parameters:
        ang - Angle in radians, positive for clockwise rotation of the camera.
        Returns:
        True if the command success.

      • getCameraOrientation

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • getPathOfLastDownloadedImage

        public java.lang.String getPathOfLastDownloadedImage()
        Description copied from interface: GenericCamera
        Returns the path of the last image downloaded. Specific implementation of this method could return the path of several files, in case more than one is created (jpg and cr2 in case of Canon cameras with JPG + RAW output mode). In this case all paths should be separated by comma.
        Specified by:
        getPathOfLastDownloadedImage in interface GenericCamera
        Returns:
        The path/s. Null in case of error when shooting last photo.

      • setFilter

        public boolean setFilter(GenericCamera.FILTER filter)
        Description copied from interface: GenericCamera
        Sets the filter to use for the next frame. This method is intended to support filter wheels, although current implementation does not support it. It can be used to set if a DSLR camera has its default IR filter or not.
        Specified by:
        setFilter in interface GenericCamera
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        True if the command success.

      • getDepth

        public int getDepth()
        Description copied from interface: GenericCamera
        Returns image depth in bits. 8 bits means a maximum intensity level of 255 in a pixel/color, usual in webcams. 14 is the usual value in modern DSLRs.
        Specified by:
        getDepth in interface GenericCamera
        Returns:
        Bits per pixel.

      • getFitsHeaderOfLastImage

        public ImageHeaderElement[] getFitsHeaderOfLastImage()
        Description copied from interface: GenericCamera
        Returns a set of entries to construct the fits header for the last shot. The set of entries are quite basic and only contains those related to the properties of the shot, and not for the telescope or other hardware. Note typical value of width/height is 0 since the size of the image is not known until it is downloaded, so these values should be set later. The entries contains the following keys: 
         Entry    Value (typical)   Description
 --------------------------------------
 
 BITPIX      32             Bits per data value
 NAXIS        2             Dimensionality
 NAXIS1       0             Width
 NAXIS2       0             Height
 EXTEND       T             Extension permitted
 MAXCOUNT   255             Max counts per pixel
 ISO        100             ISO
 TIME         1             Exposure time in s
 MODE    jpg...             Resolution mode
 RAW      false             True for raw mode
 ANGLE        0             Camera orientation angle
 INSTRUME  name             Camera name
 CAM_MODE  VIRTUAL          Camera model (driver)
 APERTURE   2.8             Aperture f/
 DEPTH       14             Pixel depth in bits
 GAIN       2.8             Gain e-/ADU
 BULBTIME    60             Exposure time in bulb mode (s)
 MAXADU    4000             Saturation level in ADUs
 FILTER      IR             Filter name
 BAYER     RGBG             Bayer matrix, top-left and clockwise
 IMGID     Dark             Image id: Dark, Flat, On, Test, or Reduced
        Specified by:
        getFitsHeaderOfLastImage in interface GenericCamera
        Returns:
        The basic header to later create the fits file.

      • setMinimumIntervalBetweenShots

        public void setMinimumIntervalBetweenShots(int seconds)
        Description copied from interface: GenericCamera
        Sets the minimum interval between shots for this camera. Default value is 0 so that consecutive shots will have minimum possible lag. Set to 30 or 60 seconds to allow the camera to get 'cooled'.
        Specified by:
        setMinimumIntervalBetweenShots in interface GenericCamera
        Parameters:
        seconds - Time in seconds.

      • getMinimumIntervalBetweenShots

        public int getMinimumIntervalBetweenShots()
        Description copied from interface: GenericCamera
        Returns the minimum interval of time allowed between shots. Default is 0.
        Specified by:
        getMinimumIntervalBetweenShots in interface GenericCamera
        Returns:
        Time in seconds.

      • getStarCatalog

        public static java.lang.String[] getStarCatalog(LocationElement eq,
                                double field,
                                int w,
                                int h,
                                double orientation,
                                GenericTelescope.MOUNT m,
                                double maglim,
                                GenericTelescope telescope,
                                TimeElement time,
                                ObserverElement obs,
                                EphemerisElement eph,
                                int nstars,
                                boolean includePlanets)
                                         throws JPARSECException
        Returns a catalog of stars in a given sky direction. This catalog can be later used to identify stars in a given field using real observations. Note that compared to SExtractor, first pixel here is (0, 0) and in SExtractor is (1, 1).
        Parameters:
        eq - The apparent equatorial position of the center of the field.
        field - The field of view in radians.
        w - Width in pixels of the image.
        h - Height in pixels of the image.
        orientation - The orientation of the field respect north or zenith (depending on the mount).
        m - The mount type, equatorial or azimuthal.
        maglim - The limiting magnitude. In case of a value greater than 10 the UCAC3 catalog will be used for stars fainter than magnitude 9.5.
        telescope - The telescope to use. The field will be inverted in horizontal or vertical axis depending on the telescope.
        time - The time object.
        obs - The observer object.
        eph - The ephemeris object.
        nstars - The number of stars to return. -1 for unlimited number.
        includePlanets - Set to true to include planets and satellites in the output catalog.
        Returns:
        A list containing all stars in the field: x position, y position, magnitude, RA, DEC (apparent), variability flag. Column separator is a comma. RA and DEC are given in radians. Variability flag is V for variable stars, N for non variable stars, and - if unknown. Additional fields include spectral type and name ("-" if unknown).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
